text:
there's a career path that is high paying 
recession-proof doesn't require a college

degree and as crazy as it sounds is a career where 
people as young as the age of 18 have been able

to land full-time jobs often working remotely 
today i'm going to go over what this career is

why you should seriously consider it and how you 
can get started this is an especially important

video for those of you that are unsure about 
going to college or if you're simply sick of

doing odd jobs and want a real career especially 
during these unsure times so make sure you pay

close attention the largest trend in recent 
times has been the mass adoption of the internet

billions of people are using it every single day 
and many of us spend more time on the internet

compared to engaging with real life in a way the 
internet is almost like another country which

would make it the largest country in the world 
now what's interesting is that all the citizens

of this country can interact with each other for 
free anyone who decides to start a business in

this country will have access to more customers 
all while spending less money than they would

had they decided to do something in real life 
a beekeeper who uses the internet to sell his

honey is almost guaranteed to make more than the 
same beekeeper who refuses to use the internet

and instead focuses on selling his honey in a 
physical store almost every business owner in

the world now realizes this and is in the process 
of transitioning these owners need people that can

help them grow online which is why i believe the 
best career path these days is anything related

to building in the digital world now some of you 
might say pill it's too late you've been talking

about this for years i doubt there's still such a 
high demand for this type of work i'm sure all of

those businesses already figured this out ages ago 
and filled all those positions but the numbers say

otherwise if we take a look at the number of job 
offerings for just one type of builder a digital

marketer essentially someone who helps businesses 
market themselves online oftentimes helping them

run their ads on google and facebook you can see 
that there were only 50 000 job openings in 2020

and now there's over 200 000 openings in 2022 
in the usa alone why is this happening well the

great lockdowns of 2020 sped up internet adoption 
by years business meetings that used to happen in

person became zoom calls overnight companies saved 
tens of thousands of dollars and everyone realized

that doing business online was simply easier 
and also more profitable and so the demand for

people who can build out the digital side of their 
businesses increased drastically the problem is

that it isn't easy to find these builders why well 
it's because many digital skills are hard to teach

in conventional school systems take for example 
growing a following on tick tock there are almost

zero universities that can teach you how to become 
an expert at tick tock because the algorithm is

constantly changing by the time the school designs 
a lesson plan for the next semester it will

already be outdated information this puts people 
who actively work on improving their digital

skills at a huge advantage this means they have 
leverage over their employers they can negotiate

for much higher wages when i first started talking 
about digital marketing five years ago the average

entry salary was around thirty thousand dollars 
nowadays the average starting rate is forty to

fifty thousand and many people quickly climb to 
sixty to seventy thousand after just one year of

experience and 80 to 90 thousand dollars after 
just two years now if you're wondering where

i'm pulling these numbers from it's actually from 
students in a digital marketing course that i've

been promoting for over five years if you want 
to learn more about it there's a link to a video

in the description box below this course is run 
by my good friend seth himes and it's a unique

course in that it actually teaches you how to get 
a real full-time job has a very high success rate

the majority of students who complete the course 
and start applying for jobs end up with job offers

in less than six months many of the students are 
18 or 19 years old and are still able to find work

because the employers are looking for a specific 
skill set and not a college degree yes that means

there are 18 year olds who go through the course 
end up getting a real job work in the industry

for two years and end up making close to a hundred 
thousand dollars every year while their peers are

still two years away from graduating college now i 
want to touch on why i believe digital careers or

recession and future proof when recessions happen 
people actually end up spending more time online

because it costs less it's the cheapest form of 
entertainment take for example concerts it costs

significantly less to host the concert online 
and you're not limited by the location or the

size of the stadium which means that a very high 
number of people can attend for a very low price

a recent travis scott concert held in fortnite had 
over 12 million attendees these are mind-boggling

numbers and you can only imagine the ways this 
could be monetized as more and more people spend

the majority of their free time online more and 
more of the economy will move online this trend

will likely go on for the next decade or two which 
means there will be a constant demand for digital

builders during recessions and also in the future 
now which type of digital career should you go for

there's so many to choose from if you're really 
good with numbers and solving problems you can

teach yourself how to program or write smart 
contracts which can land you very very high

paying jobs on the other hand if you're really 
artistic you can draw and design things but i

wouldn't recommend this path unless you've already 
been making art for over five years and of course

there's digital marketing the reason i like to 
recommend it so much is because it's one of the

easier digital skills to learn you're essentially 
just managing the digital media advertisements for

businesses i've been recommending this course to 
many people i know in real life here's a friend

of mine who couldn't find a workout at college 
i convinced him to go through the program last

year and within six months he landed a job with 
a 64 000 salary if you are interested in learning

more click on the link down below if you are 
not interested it is totally fine just find

anything that relates to building in the digital 
world heck i've even seen minecraft builders

raking large sums of cash helping metaverse 
projects build and i want to leave you with one

last thought chances are if you're watching this 
video you've grown up with the internet you've

logged in tens of thousands of hours which means 
that you've developed the skill set that most of

the older generation does not have why spend years 
trying to learn something completely new when you

have a skill that you are already somewhat decent 
at take advantage of your strengths this will help

you become successful with significantly 
less effort besides that guys stay tuned
